page.title: 06The Pharmacy Otford.
page.content: The Pharmacy is owned by a Pharmacist who has been there for 25 years. The shop used to be a family cottage. Four people are employed in the Dispensary and five staff in the shop. It is open on Saturday but closed Wednesday afternoon. Sometimes emergency prescriptions are provided outside these hours. To qualify as a Pharmacist one has to take a B.Sc. course and then do a year's practical training. Most of the 200 to 300 daily customers are from Shoreham, Otford and Kemsing. The busiest times are winter for the Pharmacy and summer and Christmas for the shop. The dangerous drugs are locked in a special cabinet. Supplies are obtained from Unichem who take three hours to deliver and from Burroughs Welcome who have computerised memory lists.
